file_content.text: Damnation. Even surrounded--even seeing you, I didn't think it would happen like this.
But as I said--it makes no difference. The Eradicators will run rampant. The Empire will burn. And you... have been betrayed.
Who's betrayed me?
What?
You lost, Eagle. Nothing can save you now.
Give up already.
Hold still. You need medical attention.
I'm taking you in alive.
My patron--the one who showed me how to unite the cells... proposed the Eradicators--is one of your own people.
A traitor in your Empire has been helping us all along. Your civilization is so corrupt that it's destroying itself.
But you haven't won. The Eradicators will still activate.
Even without orders, without targets... they'll shoot blind. Random. Fire will rain upon the Empire.
How do I stop them, Eagle? Talk!
Tell me what I want.
You don't. Not without the codes. And even I only have half. Heh.
Why? How will that serve the cause?
They'll attack randomly?
The Eradicators won't fire. You're bluffing.
I don't believe you.
There'd be no point to that. I'm dead anyway.
The Eradicators won't hit my targets... but rampant, they'll cause chaos and death.
You should be proud; one of your own people proposed the devices. My patron--a servant of the Empire--behind it all....
Give me a name.
Who?
If I had one, I might. But I never learned the truth.
Why reveal this now? What are you trying to do?
You're telling me?
Think of it as one last seed of discord... sown before Eradication Day.
Goodbye, now. Watch me burn.
He has a detonator! Get back!
Detonator! Get back!
Area is clear! Sir--are you alright?
Cipher Nine--it's Watcher Three. Are you hurt? That was a nasty explosion....
A little singed, but better than the Eagle.
I'm okay.
That really was him? Fantastic.
Sorry... Watcher Three?
Have we met?
We met on Dromund Kaas, sir, when you were posted there.
Where were you a few minutes ago?
You're late.
Sorry. Once the attack started, we had to hold the perimeter and close slowly.
Keeper sent me to assist with information retrieval--slicing the Eagle's computers.
Shut up and die.
Liar. [Kill him]
All clear! The building is secure.
Cipher Nine. Good to see you again, sir.
I don't know if you remember... I'm Watcher Three. We met on Dromund Kaas? Keeper sent me with your reinforcements.
Glad you could make it.
Of course.
Why not Watcher Two?
Why you?
She's at headquarters, tracking the information flow. I'll forward anything we find.
So long as you're not incompetent.
I don't care.
My orders are to check the Eagle's computers--see if I can retrieve any data.
I'll also check out that... device there. I think it's an Eradicator.
Move fast--the Eradicators may still be a threat.
Get to it.
Yes, sir!
Is that going to be dangerous?
Sounds like trouble.
Shouldn't be. The Eradicators are designed for orbital attacks. Guess we'll find out....
You do that. I need to clean terrorist bits off me.
Fine, whatever.
Ah. Right. Of course.
Cipher? I've got some preliminary findings. It's... not good news.
I overheard what the Eagle said--looks like he was telling the truth. If no one gives the Eradicators new orders, they'll go mad. Fire randomly.
Any idea how to disable them?
What do we do?
How much damage can they do?
Is it bad?
A few dozen are out there. Tens of thousands of people could die.
Who thought that was a good failsafe?
Bad design choice.
It's part of their organic nature--not really a choice, I don't think.
Here's the good part. I figured out their control mechanism. Transmit the proper codes, and you can set the devices' targets, disable them, anything.
The Eagle stored half the control codes on his computers... someone else must have the second half.
The Eagle mentioned a patron.
His mysterious ally.
Yes, sir. The one inside the Empire. Not sure what that means.
So he couldn't have activated the Eradicators himself?
He didn't have the codes?
Doesn't look it. The Eagle must have been waiting for his partner. They would've targeted the Eradicators, activated them together.
You're good with computers. Fake the damn codes.
So find a solution!
I'm really sorry, sir, but I don't think I can. I'll do my best.
You should head to Dromund Kaas. I don't think there's anything more you can do here, and Keeper wants you back at headquarters.
If we die, we die for the revolution!
Sir, we're cut off. Thurson and Jeryl tried to get out, but the Imperials are all over the swamps....
They would be. Damnation.
I promised Jeryl she'd die with a detonator in one hand and a glass of brandy in the other. It seems she's made a liar of me.
I'm sorry, sir.
Don't be. You were everything I could have hoped for. Now carve us a path out--I'll follow soon.
All right, I see you. The least I could do was send the boy off with hope.
But have you seen the strength of the revolution? Cells on Nar Shaddaa, Tholatin, Molavar, Alderaan, Balmorra... it's an inspiration, no matter how it ends.
Are you the Eagle?
Hello?
The Eagle is a symbol. I'm just a man.
Your "inspiration" is terrorism, plain and simple.
There's no "revolution."
Nothing is plain or simple about terrorism. About rebellion. Or about... covert intelligence. That is your field, I presume. You don't look military.
Tell me something: How much of my story has the Empire uncovered? What have your "methods" found?
Why do you ask?
Huh?
Because if you're going to fight me, you should know what you're facing.
We found out all about your little orbital weapons. Your Eradicators.
We know you plan to attack.
Ha! Look behind me. That--that!--is an Eradicator.
No one cared about you before you killed Darth Jadus. I don't think there was much to learn.
You're nothing.
Then listen. I'll tell you about the birth of the Eagle.
I was a starfighter pilot. I flew in the battles of Coruscant and Druckenwell. Those were... romantic days.
Then, I began to lose squad-mates. Some fell to Republic troopers. Imperial Intelligence erased others. I wondered... was my Empire worth it?
What answer did you come to?
And?
A true soldier--any true Imperial--would know the answer to that.
A patriot doesn't question.
I was a true Imperial. I was a blasted hero.
Does your story have a point, or are you just stalling?
This is getting old.
To hear the tale, you take the risk--because you'll never have another chance.
I realized that the Empire destroys people. Our once-great society runs on human fuel and serves no purpose beyond ego.
I decided to fight for a return to the old Empire--the Empire isolated on Dromund Kaas for a thousand years. I thought I could succeed.
You say "thought"--past tense.
But something changed?
You really think things were better before we showed ourselves to the Republic?
The "old Empire"?
During our dark millennium, we reached civilization's zenith. Modern ambition has corrupted us.
I recruited allies who felt as I did--but we were so few.
Then I was approached by a... patron. Someone who gave me a list of other revolutionaries, other revolutions across the galaxy.
This grand "terror network"--it wasn't your idea.
You didn't plan this yourself?
My patron was the spark. I am the flame.
This patron... who was he?
Patron?
Even I'm not sure. But I'm more certain than ever how far the Empire has fallen.
I sought my counterparts on many planets. They hated for different reasons, but we all shared a vision of the Empire's defeat.
I gave up my name to lead them. I was no longer an ex-starfighter pilot--I was the Eagle. I was what the revolution needed.
I'm Cipher Nine. I'm the Empire's way of stopping you.
I gave up my name, too.
Killing me changes nothing. The revolution lives on--another Eagle will rise.
You think you're special? You're just a murderer.
You've got some ego.
Many would say the same of you.
Even in death, I'll have my victory. Six dozen Eradicator devices are already in place.
That's all over. [Attack]
I'm getting tired of this rambling. Tell me about the coming attack.
Talk about the Eradicators.
You want to know about the Eradicators? Look behind me. That--that!--is an Eradicator.
Technology developed on Dromund Kaas and Balmorra. They can be grown anywhere; six dozen are already in place.
They'll wait to receive orders--at first. But eventually, without commands... they'll run rampant. Fire blindly at cities from orbit.
Why would they do that?
What?
Consider it a safeguard.
Surrender, and we can work out a deal. Stop this attack.
Let's handle this peacefully.
There will be no deals.
The Eradicators are worthless. Without you, the threat ends.
You're bluffing.
You're not enough of a fool to believe that.
Uncontrolled, the Eradicators won't hit our targets--but chaos and death still send a message.
Now--I believe my forces have had time to regroup. May whoever survives see a glorious future for the Empire.
Now we're done. May whoever survives see a glorious future for the Empire.
You were doomed from the start.
You were a fool. [Attack]
Perhaps. Whoever survives this will see... on Eradication Day!
When it ends with your death, you won't be so inspired.
You'd be surprised. [Attack]
It won't end with my death, though. It won't even end on Eradication Day!
Get out of here.
None of you are going to leave this base alive.
